   contiguous (adjacent) territory  .

  Gran Sabana, Piar, Raul Leoni, Rocio, Sifontes and Sucre).
  Recommended prevention: B in P. vivax risk areas; C in P.
  falciparum risk areas.

Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P.
  falciparum, exists in the whole country, excluding urban
  centres, the Red River Delta, the Mekong Delta and the
  coastal plain areas of central Viet Nam. High risk areas are
  the highland areas below 1500 m. south of 18N, notably the
  four central highlands provinces of Dak Lak, Dak Nong, Gia
  Lai and Kon Tum, Binh Phuoc province and the western parts
  of the coastal provinces Khanh Hoa, Ninh Thuan , Quang Nam
  and Quang Tri. Recommended prevention in risk areas: C.

vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within
10 days from countries with risk of yellow fever transmission
For details, click here. 

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission For details, click here for max. 12 hours and not leaving
  the transit area. 
- Children under 1 year of age, provided holding a medical
  certificate stating inoculation is undesirable.
- Holders of a certificate of contraindication on medical
  grounds, who will be placed under quarantine.
Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P.
  falciparum, exists throughout the year in the low altitude
  areas of Limpopo Province, Mpumalanga Province (including
  the Kruger National Park) and north-eastern Kwazulu Natal as
  far south as the Tugela river. Risk is highest from October
  to May. Recommended prevention in risk areas: C.

longInfo:
Passport required. 
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for a minimum of 4 months beyond the period of
  intended stay. 

Visa Issuance:
Visa required, except for Nationals of Norway can obtain a
visa on arrival, if: (SEE NOTE 49008)(SEE NOTE 53404) 
 - traveling as tourists, for a max. stay of 90 days. Fee: USD
   50.- (single entry) and USD 80.- (multiple entry). 
 - traveling on business, for a max. stay of 30 days.Fee: USD
   50.- (single entry) and USD 80.- (multiple entry). 
    NOTE 49008: Passport must contain at least one unused visa
   page for the visa sticker. 
    NOTE 53404: The max. stay is granted within one year.
Visa required, except for Nationals of Norway when traveling
as tourists can obtain Univisa on arrival at Livingstone (LVI)
and Lusaka (LUN).  (SEE NOTE 49008) 
    NOTE 49008: Passport must contain at least one unused visa
   page for the visa sticker.

Visa Issuance:
Visa required, except for Nationals of Norway can obtain visa
on arrival, provided: 
 - traveling as tourists, for a max. stay of 3 months. Fees
   vary between USD 30.- and USD 70.-, or equivalent in EUR or
   GBP. 
 - traveling on business, for a max. stay of 30 days. Fees
   vary between USD 30.- and USD 70.-, or equivalent in EUR or
   GBP. 
Visa required, except for Nationals of Norway when traveling
as tourists can obtain a Univisa on arrival at Harare (HRE)
and Victoria Falls (VFA).

vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission For details, click here.

Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P.
  falciparum, exists from November through June in the whole
  country below 1200 m and throughout the year in the Zambezi
  valley. In Harare and Bulawayo, the risk is negligible.
  Recommended prevention in risk areas: C.
